episodes.title: Charles Manson & DEATH VALLEY: Murder Plot, Cults, Barker Ranch, Myers Ranch, Helter Skelter & More
episodes.description:
Full documentary: https://youtu.be/_S9BUTM_Flo

Barker ranch & Myers ranch are two of the key locations in the Charles Manson story. Although Spahn ranch is the most famous of the Manson ranches, Barker & Myers played a key role in the Manson Family. In this video I’ll exploring exactly how & much more. 

Scientology, Barker Ranch, Death Valley & more - What do they all have in common? In the full video I’ll exploring all of that & more.

In 1967, Charles Manson moved to the Haight Ashbury district of San Francisco - The epicentre of the hippie movement. Particularly during the summer of 1967 (aka the summer of love) Haight Ashbury was flooded with hippies from across the world. These hippies would often experiment with drugs.

Many believe this rampant drug use in Haight Ashbury was exploited and even perpetuated to an extent by the CIA, a dark wide scale experiment for the MK ULTRA program. At the centre of this theory is the Haight Ashbury Free Medical

Many people believe Charles Manson was a CIA asset. More specifically, that he was part of the CIA’s MK Ultra program: MK Ultra experimented with LSD extensively in  mind control experiments.

LSD was a major factor in the Manson family: Charles Manson’s control over his followers had a lot to do with acid (LSD). He would frequently give his followers LSD. Then while his followers were under the influence, Manson would repeatedly suggest things to them, over and over again. 

This method of brainwashing people by LSD and repeated suggestions, was studied by the CIA. In other words, Manson’s LSD brainwashing techniques were the same as the CIA’s - One of several reasons many believe Manson was in fact a CIA asset - More specifically, that he was part of the CIA’s MK Ultra program.

As of this posting, I'm also preparing videos on possible connections between prominent artists of the 60s & the CIA, including The Doors.

------------
The Doors, the FBI & Jim Morrison: Throughout the end of the 1960s until the early 70s, the FBI & President Nixon kept a close eye on Jim Morrison. In this documentary, I'll be exploring exactly what happened. I will also be exploring the history of the Manson murders. 

Charles Manson & Jim Morrison? The police questioned Jim Morrison after the Manson murders, I’ll be taking a look at that and a lot more in this video. It’s been speculated Charles Manson was involved in the CIA’s MKUltra mind control program, that will be a subject for another video.

The Doors discography consists of The Doors (1967), Strange Days (1967), Waiting for the Sun (1968), The Soft Parade (1969), Morrison Hotel (1970), L.A. Woman (1971), Other Voices (1971), Full Circle (1972), An American Prayer (1978).

Some of The Doors biggest hits include Riders On The Storm, LA Woman, When The Music’s Over, People Are Strange, The End, Hello I Love You, Break On Through (To The Other Side), Love Street, Roadhouse Blues, Light My Fire, Love Me Two Times, Five To One, Waiting For The Sun, Gloria, Alabama Song, Indian Summer & more. Some of The Doors most famous concerts include the infamous Miami incident, the Hollywood Bowl & more. Icons of the 60s psychedelic & hippie scene. 

The Doors were Jim Morrison, Ray Manzarek, Robby Krieger & John Densmore. Pamela Courson was Jim’s main girlfriend & the last person to see him alive before his death in Paris France in July 3 1971. They are one of the greatest classic rock bands ever.

Some of the Rolling Stones biggest songs include Paint It Black, (I Can’t Get No) Satisfaction, Sympathy For The Devil, Angie, Gimmie Shelter, Miss You, Anybody Seen My Baby, Start Me Up, Beast Of Burden, She’s A Rainbow, Can’t You Hear Me Knocking, Waiting on A Friend, Ride ‘Em On Down, Wild Horses, Doom And Gloom, She’s So Cold, Miss You, Can’t You Hear Me Knocking, Baby Please Don’t Go, You Can’t Always Get What You Want, Love Is Strong, Like A Rolling Stone, Rock Me Baby, Fool To Cry, Living In A Ghost Town, Brown Sugar, It’s Only Rock ’N’ Roll (But I Like It), As Tears Go by, Under My Thumb, Jumpin’ Jack Flash, Time Waits For No One. 

The Stones current lineup consists of Mick Jagger, Keith Richards & Ronnie Wood. Brian Jones, Ian Stewart, Bill Wyman, Charlie Watts & Mick Taylor are former members.

Cheers,
Daniel
